subject: Bank of China Hong Kong (2388 HK) lowered property mortgage rates; according to HK press
BoJ Tankan inflation survey shows Japanese firms expect inflation to rise 0.9% a year from now (vs. Prev. 0.8%)
content:
• Expects inflation to rise 1.1% 3yrs from now (vs. Prev. 1.1%)
  • Expects inflation to rise 1.2% 5yrs from now (vs. Prev. 1.1%)

subject: Italian coalition leaders have reached an agreement on the 2019 budget; according to ANSA
analysis_details: • This echoes earlier comments from the League spokeswoman who stated that Italy's Deputy PMs Di Maio, Salvini and PM Conte are in "total agreement" on 2019 budget figures to propose to Brussels

subject: PRE-MARKET JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS:  Mitsubishi Motors (8306 JT) re-enters tie-up with Daimler (DAI GY). (Nikkei)
content:
Japan

Stocks

Askul Corp (2678 JT)
- Reports H1 net JPY 315mln vs. Prev. JPY 3.4bln. Operating profit JPY 1.0bln vs. Prev. JPY 2.3bln. Revenue JPY 191.4bln vs. Prev. JPY 171.7bln. (Newswires)

Kumiai Chemical (4996 JT)
- FY 18 net JPY 4.7bln vs. Prev. JPY  7.3bln. Operating profit JPY 5.6bln vs. Prev. JPY 5.6bln. Revenue JPY 96.9bln vs. Prev. JPY 77.8bln. (Newswires)

Japan Tobacco (2914 JT)
- Reports November domestic cigarette -12.8% Y/Y to 6.1bln units. Domestic cigarette revenue -6.7% Y/Y to JPY 39.2bln. Jan-Nov cigarette revenue -10.3% Y/Y to JPY 453bln.

Nissan (7201 JT)
- Co. says it remains “steadfast” in commitment to alliance while offering to share Goshn information with Renault (RNO FP). Furthermore, Renault acting CEO has asked Nissan to call an EGM as soon as possible to discuss future alliance. (Newswires/FT)

Sony (6758 JT)
-“Spiderman: Into the Spider-Verse” has reached USD 35.4mln in sales and is the top movie in North-American box office, while “Aquaman” reached USD 126.4mln in worldwide sales.

Clarion (6796 JT)
-Co is said to be planning to stop exporting products from China base. (Newswires)

Japan Display (6740 JT)
- Co. denies reports that is considering selling part of its business. (Newswires)

Tokyo Electric Power (9501 JT)
- Co. is considering not funding the Hitachi UK nuclear project. (Nikkei)

Sumitomo Mistsui Financial Group (8316 JT)
- Confirms reports that CEO Takeshi Kunibe is to become chairman. (Newswires)

 Mitsubishi Motors (8306 JT)
-Co. re-enters tie-up with Daimler (DAI GY) after 13 years. (Nikkei)

Broker Moves

SUMITOMO MITSUI TRUST HOLDING (8309 JT) UPGRADED TO OUTPERFROM FROM NEUTRAL AT DAIWA SECURITIES

 

South Korea

-South Korean Finance Minister Hong is to meet with BoK governor Lee later this week. (Newswires)

- US President Trump said they are in no hurry regarding discussions with North Korea. This comes after US military assessment found North Korea to be ignoring sanctions and transferring oil at sea. (Newswires)

- South Korea imports of Iranian Crude fell to zero in November (Prev. 1.3mln tons Y/Y)

Stocks

Samsung (005930 KS)
-Co. is said to be taking part in a funding round for Niantic, valuing the Co. at USD 3.9bln. (Newswires)

Hyundai (005380 KS)
- Co. signs six-round 2019 WRC deal with rally driver Sebastien Loeb. (Yonhap)

KAI (047810 KS)
-Co. won a KRW 200bln medical helicopter deal. (Yonhap)

subject: Italy's Deputy PMs Di Maio, Salvini and PM Conte are in "total agreement" on 2019 budget figures to propose to Brussels; according to a League spokeswoman
content: • Spokeswoman denies tensions within coalition and media reports that PM had threatened to resign

subject: Saudi Arabia says the killing of Jounalist Kashoggi is a crime that does not reflect the Kingdom's policy; via state news agency
Australia Mid-year Economic and Fiscal Outlook: Cut 2018/19 GDP to 2.75% (Prev. 3.0%)
content:
• 2018/19 underlying cash deficit AUD 5.2bln (Prev. AUD 14.5bln)
  • 2019/20 surplus AUD 4.1bln (Prev. AUD 2.2bln)

subject: PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIA STOCK NEWS: ASX to open lower following the weak lead from Wall St. amid disappointing Chinese economic data and ongoing Brexit uncertainty. (AFR)
content:
Stocks

Banks - Macquarie said that the RBNZ’s new capital demand could lead to major bank asset sales. (AFR)

ANZ (ANZ AT)
- In a follow-up to RBNZ’s capital review paper, bank sees potential capital increase for New Zealand of NZD 6.0-8.0bln. (Newswires)

Rio Tinto (RIO AT)
- Co. completes the sale of Dunkerque Aluminium smelter to Liberty House. (Newswires)

BHP (BHP AT)
- Co has completed USD 5.2bln off market share buyback programme. (Newswires)

Clearview (CVW AT)
- Co. extended share buyback programme for an additional year. (Newswires)

Tomizone (TOM AT)
- Co. names John Seton as independent chairman effective immediately. (Newswires)

Domain Holdings (DHG AT)
- Co. are to acquire CommercialView.com.au for AUD 4.2-17.2mln contingent on targets in relations to future financial performance of the CommercialView and CREM businesses. Transaction is aimed to occurred on 21st December 2018. (Newswires)

Imugene (IMU AT)
- Co.’s gastric cancer immune-oncology trial has met endpoints in Phase 1B with no reported safety issues. (Newswires)

Austal (ASB AT)
- Co. has been awarded US DoD contract to build two additional Littoral Combat ships with no terms disclosed. (Newswires)

SpeedCast International (SDA AT)
- Co. has completed the USD 134mln acquisition of Globecomm. (Newswires)

Amaysim Australia (AYS AT)
- CEO said Co. is to launch new energy products in H1 2019 which will be branded Amaysim Energy and model will be based on Company’s core mobile data plans. (AFR)

Resolute Mining (RSG AT)
- Co. announces that cave mining started as scheduled and on budget (Newswires)

Oil
- Brent Feb’19 futures fell almost 2% on Friday as global slowdown concerns outweigh OPEC+ production cuts.

Broker Moves

NEW HOPE CORP (NHC AT) UPGRADED TO OUTPERFORM FROM NEUTRAL AT CREDIT SUISSE

PANORAMIC RESOURCES (PAN AT) INITIATED WITH OUTPERFORM AT MACQUARIE

DULUX GROUP (DLX AT) UPGRADED TO ADD FROM HOLD AT MORGANS FINANCIALS

TPG TELECOM (TPM AT) UPGRADED TO NEUTRAL FRO SELL AT GOLDMAN SACHS

ORIGIN ENERGY (ORG AT) UPGRADED TO ADD FROM HOLD AT MORGANS FINANCIAL

Politics

PM Morrison’s government has suffered another setback after weeks of campaigning to gain ground against Labour, trailing by 46 to 54 per cent in a two-party result that would trigger a landslide loss at an election. (SMH)

subject: ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include Australian Mid-Year Economic and Fiscal outlook and Indonesian Trade Balance
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
17th December 2018

ASIA-PAC

US President Trump says China wants to make a big, comprehensive deal; it could happen rather soon. (Twitter)

Canada says it has been granted consular access to one of the two men detained by China this week (Newswires) It was later reported via SCMP that Canada’s Ambassador to China McCallum has met with the second detained Canadian Kovrig. (SCMP)


DATA

Chinese House Prices YY Nov 9.3% (Prev. 8.6%)

New Zealand Services PMI (Nov) 53.5 (Prev. 55.4)

Indian Trade Deficit Govt (USD) Nov 16.67B vs. Exp. 16.08B (Prev. 17.13B)
Indian Exports (USD) Nov 26.50B (Prev. 26.98B)
Indian Imports (USD) Nov 43.17B (Prev. 44.11B)

UK

A row has reportedly erupted in Labour Leader Corbyn's top team over the timing to push a vote of no confidence in PM May's government. Labour sources declined to rule out tabling a no-confidence motion this week, but the party is said to be more likely to strike after the meaningful vote in January. (The Independent)

PM May’s Deputy David Lidington and Number 10 Chief of Staff Gavin Barwell said they do not favour a second referendum after The Times reported that the two senior ministers were preparing for a second referendum behind PM May's back. (Newswires)

UK Attorney General Cox has reportedly told Cabinet Ministers that PM May has to be “removed” after Brexit, so others can renegotiate her deal; according The Telegraph citing sources. (The Telegraph)

ITV’s Political Correspondent Paul Brand tweeted “Understand cabinet members pushing for a second referendum or votes on other options in parliament were all freelancing. Downing Street's official position has not budged. Tomorrow PM will come out hard against a second referendum.” (Twitter)

BuzzFeed's Alex Wickham tweeted: Theresa May’s close allies are pushing for a second referendum to win a mandate for her Brexit deal, face down a “suicide squad” of Brexiteers and keep Jeremy Corbyn out of Number 10. (Twitter)

Senior Tories who had showed loyalty to PM May as she faced a no-confidence vote were secretly organising leadership bids to replace her. (The Times)

Labour activists have launched a fresh campaign for a second referendum, pressuring Labour Leader Corbyn to drop his resistance to a new public vote. (BBC)

PM May is being urged to allow Tory MPs a free vote in a series of ballots over different options regarding Brexit's next steps, including a second referendum. PM May will meet her Cabinet on Tuesday to outline options. (The Guardian)

A poll by Opinium Research shows PM May received an approval rating of 47%, the highest since the start of her premiership. (Sky News)

The European Commission, on Wednesday, will publish its contingency action plans for a no-deal Brexit, covering up to 13 areas that threatens chaos. (The Times)

Irish PM Varadkar said there are no proposal for a special summit in January. (Newswires) This follows reports from last week that they may be another Brexit summit in January.

EU Commission President Juncker said the EU does not want the Irish backstop to be a permanent instrument. Meanwhile, EU Council President Tusk said he has no mandate to re-open Brexit negotiations. (Newswires)
 

EU

Italian government has the resources to afford a 2.04% deficit/GDP target; according to ANSA. The newspaper also reported that Italy's Cabinet Undersecretary Giorgetti said if the current govt fails, Italy should go to early elections. (ANSA)

Italy's Economy Minister Tria has ended talks with EU's Moscovici and Dombrovskis, negotiations continue, and the atmosphere is positive; according to the Treasury. (Newswires)

Italy PM Conte said the government is working to complete the proposal for a revised budget; talks will continue with the EU until a compromise is found, confident it will happen. (Newswires)

Bank of Italy expects Italy's 2018 GDP growth at 0.9% (Prev. 1.2%) and sees GDP growth at around 1% in period 2019-202

French PM Phillip says France’s 2019 budget deficit is likely to stand at around 3.2%. (Les Echos)

ECB's Nowotny (Hawk) says in his view the ECB has achieved its inflation target
 

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes Rig Count (14/Dec): Oil down 4 at 173, NatGas unchanged at 198; total down 4 at 1071. (Newswires)

Libyan El-Feel oilfield located near closed El Sharara field is working normally; according to Libya's NOC, while adding that "paying ransom to the militia" will not reopen the 300K BPD El-Sharara oil field (Newswires)

India's November crude imports from Iran -42% M/M to 275.33k BPD (vs. 477.4k BPD in October); according to tanker tracking and shipping data. (Newswires)


GEOPOLITICAL

US still believes that N. Korea are still transferring oil at sea. (Newswires)

Russia and UK are in discussions about restoring embassy staffs; according to Interfax. (Interfax)

EM

Mexican President AMLO proposed a primary surplus of 1% of GDP for 2019 and his administration expects this year’s surplus to be about 0.8%. Budget proposal includes USD/MXN at 20.00, oil production of 1.847mln BPD. (Newswires)

US

US President Trump is reportedly mulling the prospect of preventing a partial government shutdown and delaying the border wall fight until January; according to Politico citing two sources familiar with the negotiations. (Politico)

US President Trump announced Mick Mulvaney (Director of the Office of Management and Budget) as acting White House Chief of Staff following the departure of General John Kelly. (Twitter)


MARKET RECAP

Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) underperformed after reports it sat, knowingly, on information its talcum powder contained asbestos. Costco (COST) traded lower on the back of reporting revenue below estimates. Adobe (ADBE) was down on the open after lowering its earnings guidance. Starbucks (SBUX) underperformed as it lowered its EPS guidance estimates. Apple (AAPL) moved lower following a notable analyst slashing its sales forecasts. Goldman Sachs upgraded Regeneron (REGN) causing it to trade higher and downgraded Walgreens Boots (WBA) causing the consumer staple to move lower. Electronic Arts (EA) nosedived on the session open on the back of a price cut and negative November sales data from the NPD group but the stock pared back losses through the day; Activision Blizzard (ATVI) and Take-Two (TTWO) also opened lower. SPX -1.91% at 2599.95, NDX -2.26% at 6910.67, DJI -2.02% at 24100.51.

Treasuries rose on Friday as traders digested the weak Chinese industrial production data and retail ahead of the FOMC meeting this week where consensus are for 25bpd hike, though 2019 hike expectations have been dampened by worries if a potential slowdown in economic growth. The 10yr US government debt yield fell to 2.895% while the 30yr yield moved lower to 3.150%
